events.title: First modern Olympic Games announced
events.description: The International Olympic Committee announced that the first modern Olympic Games would be held in Athens, Greece, reviving the ancient tradition.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of the modern Olympic movement, promoting international sports competition and unity.

events.title: Birth of T.S. Eliot
events.description: Thomas Stearns Eliot, an influential American-English poet, essayist, publisher, playwright, and literary critic, was born.
events.significance: Eliot became one of the 20th century's major poets, notably for works like 'The Waste Land' and 'The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock'.

events.title: British Expeditionary Force evacuates from Dunkirk
events.description: The evacuation of allied soldiers from the beaches of Dunkirk, France, was completed, rescuing over 338,000 troops during World War II.
events.significance: This evacuation was a pivotal moment in WWII, preserving the core of Britain's fighting forces against Nazi Germany.

events.title: Schuman Declaration proposed the European Coal and Steel Community
events.description: French foreign minister Robert Schuman proposed the creation of the European Coal and Steel Community, laying groundwork for European integration.
events.significance: This declaration is considered a foundational step towards the creation of the European Union, fostering peace and cooperation in Europe.

events.title: India conducts nuclear tests
events.description: India carried out a series of nuclear tests at Pokhran, asserting itself as a nuclear weapons state.
events.significance: These tests altered the strategic balance in South Asia and had significant implications for global non-proliferation efforts.
